cyclone.name: LAURA
cyclone.current_location: about 40 mi (65 km) SE of St. Croix
cyclone.trajectory: moving west-northwest across the Greater Antilles through the weekend, forecast to enter the Gulf of Mexico early next week and then arc toward the north-western Gulf Coast (TX/LA) by mid-week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: north-western Gulf Coast (likely Louisiana or the upper Texas coast)

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from Texas to Alabama
weather_observation.wind: Low (≤6%) chance of tropical-storm-force winds (≥34 kt) reaching Galveston late Tue–Wed; gusty conditions possible.
weather_observation.storm_surge: If Laura tracks closer to the upper Texas coast as a hurricane, a surge of 3–5 ft above ground is possible; confidence remains low at this lead time.
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rain bands could bring 2–4 in of rain to Galveston mid-week, with localized heavier amounts if the core tracks closer.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough seas and dangerous rip currents beginning mid-week could disrupt vessel traffic and berthing operations.
